column4: How does ssh maintain a connection even after my computer is suspended and resumed?

That's what I had thought. And you wouldn't believe the sorcery  that happened just now. There was a power cut, right? So no internet for me. So I suspended, I resumed after power came back, and lo and behold ssh was still there.
dpac:did the remote machine you ssh`d have the same IP?
jimerickson: Same IP? It's my web server, so yes it has a static IP, if that's what you mean
Same IP? It's my web server, so yes it has a static IP, if that's what you mean
then ssh must have been reconnected
My private keys are protected by a passphrase
your ssh must`ve not send a disconnect event to your remote host
and when you suspend your computer it saves anything on the RAM (including all the passphrases)
so when you resumed everything was good

That's possible, but it was a power cut. So my router turned off. There's no way my router can resume connections even after a power cut. And there's no way remote host would keep a connection active without keep-alive packets from me.
It's mindboggling. I'll try asking on stackoverflow or something
